name: OGLE-2006-BLG-109L
scenarioDescription:
The OGLE-2006-BLG-109L Exoplanetary System

OGLE-2006-BLG-109L is a star with 0.51 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.6099999999999999 times its radius. It is located 4924.96 light years away from the solar system.

OGLE-2006-BLG-109L is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

OGLE-2006-BLG-109L b

OGLE-2006-BLG-109L b was discovered by the OGLE observatory using the microlensing method. Its discovery was announced in 2008-02. Its semi-major axis is 2.30 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 1788.50 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, OGLE-2006-BLG-109L.

The mass of OGLE-2006-BLG-109L b is 232.00 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, OGLE-2006-BLG-109L b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.

OGLE-2006-BLG-109L c

OGLE-2006-BLG-109L c was discovered by the OGLE observatory using the microlensing method. Its discovery was announced in 2008-02. Its semi-major axis is 4.50 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 4927.50 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, OGLE-2006-BLG-109L.

Its eccentricity, the extent to which the shape of the exoplanet's orbit departs from a perfect circle (Earth's is 0.0167, which is why the shape of Earth's orbit is circular rather than oval in appearance), is 0.15, which means that when OGLE-2006-BLG-109L c is at is at its closest point to its host star, 3.82 astronomical units separates the two, and when it is at its farthest point, this number is 5.17. In the case of Earth, these numbers are 0.9832899 and 1.0167103 respectively.

The mass of OGLE-2006-BLG-109L c is 85.81 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, OGLE-2006-BLG-109L c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system OGLE-2006-BLG-109L, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by OGLE.
